title.narrative: CHILD AND GENDER SENSITIVE BUDGETING

description.narrative: By 2016, duty bearers have increased national capacities to effectively implement a child and gender sensitive budgeting approach in national budgets, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Evaluation And Research, Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Equity-sensitive national policies, programmes and budget allocations are made based on reliable, disaggregated data reflecting the actual situation of girls and boys and their families in line with the CRC, CEDAW and the Millennium Development Goals. By 2014, all countries will have fulfilled their Convention reporting obligations and by 2016 will have taken actions to comply with all Concluding Observations of the Committee on the Rights of the Child

sector.narrative: Building evaluation capacity in UNICEF and the UN system

Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
Child poverty measurement: support to routine national measurement of monetary and multidimensional child poverty
Country programme process (including UNDAF planning and CCA)
ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)
PF4C - domestic revenue mobilization and access to finance for key social services
PF4C: Improving public expenditure effectiveness / efficiency
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, duty bearers have increased national capacities to effectively implement a child and gender sensitive budgeting approachin national budgets

description.narrative: Child and Gender sensitive budgeting training have led to -St. Lucia, Montserrat and BVI- to conduct analysis on budget investment for children and fiscal space study on social protection floor | Status:On-track | As-of Date:02/12/2016

title.narrative: Fiscal space analysis for social protection floor conducted and specified policy recommendations available to establish national social protection floor.

actual.value: 2016:1 finalized (St Lucia), 2 pending finalization (The Virgin islands/UK and Monserrat)

title.narrative: Revised human rights based national legislative framework on social protection available.

actual.value: 2016:2 countries have draft bills on social protection (Antigua & Barbuda, Montserrat)

title.narrative: Child and gender sensitive national social protection policy/strategy, costed action plans and monitoring and evaluation frameworks are in place.

actual.value: 2016:3 social protection policies in place (St Kitts & Nevis, St Lucia, Grenada)

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Information and reports on child-focused public expenditures (by sector and sub-sector) is available by governments; sectors are health, nutrition, child protection, social protection, WASH and education
